reviewText:
You should play this game if you like:
- Simple design games,
- Easy-to-learn but challenging games,
- Local multiplayer games
- And snakes.

The game has a big variery of game modes. Modes for aaaall the tastes. For those who like challenges, there are levels and endless modes. For those who are creative, there is a mode for you and you can also test your skills building your own levels and shared them in the workshop. For those who just play with company, you can play with up to 7 friends in the same computer (omg how's that even possible??")
recommended: just a warning: there will be a lot of tiny snakes. So if you don't like snakes you probably shouldn't be here... Kidding.\nAnd of course
hoursPlayed: I couldn't help to mention Nokia 3310's Snake. If you know what I'm talking about it's self-explainatory.\n\nWhat I enjoy the most about this game is the adventure mode and making commutiny levels (I already created some levels myself). I also liked the soundtrack. It's very pleasent and well chosen."
voteText: January 29

reviewText: This game is marketed as Snake with a twist" - which is the most correct definition possibkle. Instead of moving vertically and horizontally
date: you are moving circular. This makes for an interesting game experience.\n\nAlso
recommended: the dev is a cool guy who listens to feedback and solves your issues

reviewText: Curvatron is a relaxing yet super challenging game to play. The adventure mode and community levels are an awesome addition to the mobile version which was already great per se. If you happen to have 7 friends around don't miss the opportunity to try to play the multiplayer mode while everyone struggles to use the keyboard :D

reviewText:
A Arcade Game Based Off Classic Snakehttps://youtu.be/SjsLQXmfTiM
+ Fantastic relaxing soundtrack (30+ songs wow!)
+ Visually the game looks very nice even though it's very simplistic
+ Challenging gameplay that really tests your timing and reflexes
+ Multiple game modes
+ Map Editor + Steam Workshop to easily play others maps
+ Local Multiplayer

- Can be pretty frusterating at later levels
- The game itself is very basic, making it feel repetitive after a short while

reviewerDisplayName: Sam - Check out GameX on YT!
reviewText:
Curvatron is the most delightfully simple, elagant and infuriatingly ♥♥♥♥ing difficult piece of ♥♥♥♥ I have ever played.
And.... That's exactly why I've loved playing it thus far. I was given a copy of the game by the publisher to check it out. So far I haven't played enough to record my full video review of the game, but have played enough to recommend this out to any fan of the classic SNAKE.

Curvatron has some of the smoothest graphics available, and while I may have considered it too simple for a game worth purchasing, I believe the mechanics and music are more than worth the purchase. There has been a lot of work put into the level design and different game modes.

Final Words

I recommend Curvatron to anyone who loves SNAKE, but hates themselves.

reviewText: This is about the most frustrating game I've played, and I've only gotten to level 5 so far. I contributed music to level 16 and decided to quickly check out how it sounded in game. Sadly, I don't think I'll ever be able to get to that level, despite my initial plans of rushing through the first fifteen levels. That being said though, the game is really cool - I love the art style and the fact that there's only one control. I'd definitely recommend checking it out if you like arcade games.

reviewText:
UPDATE - The game is fixed and works perfectly for me. Yay!

I like this game. It is easy to make levels and can be wonderfully frusterating to play. I made a bunch of levels using the doors, very hard.

That said, the Steam version will not run for me. My antivirus's (Avast and Malwarebytes) both flagged the installer as a problem. I forced them to ignore and it installed. It still does not play. It shows a window with a title of Curvatron and it is solid black, nothing happens.

I talked to the developer and this is a problem with Steams wrapper" for loading games in the Steam client. He plans a stand alone PC version - yay!"

reviewText:
The game's not lying to you, it does say that you'll play these game modes until you quit in frustration.

I do strongly believe that with practise, you'll get a whole lot better, but I also believe you'll only enjoy this as an enthusiast of this particular challenge of finesse and wrapping your head around the control scheme. A nice twist.
